comments:
When you have a java class that implements serializable in 3.1.x or 3.2, and you have not included a serialversionUID of type long, you get a warning stating such in the "Problems" view.  Particularly if the file is under ClearCase source control, the quickFix option that is visible in the "Problems" view will error out.  On Eclipse 3.1.x it shows a popup that states:

There are no quick fixes available for the selected marker.

On eclipse 3.2M4, a popup appears and dissapears (very quickly!) and I get the following in the error log:

Error 2006-02-06 12:25:30.649 Unhandled event loop exception

Once the file is checked out, or made writable, the quickfix option works as desired.  I also note that when the file is checked in or readonly, the quickfix option obtained by right-clicking on the warning marker in the source editor dissapears... but it is *still available* in the Problems view.  I have also found that the quickFix utility (whatever or wherever it is) does not appear to call the ClearCase plugin's validateEdit/validateSave methods... in other words, it appears that when using CC as a source control provider, you cannot actuate quick fix and be prompted to checkout the file or even make it readable...
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 124953 ***
John see Bug 126971 for this issue
